data.title: ‘Cobra Kai’ Moves Up Season 6, Part 2 On Netflix—Here’s The New Release Schedule
data.meta_description: The creators of "Cobra Kai" announced on Wednesday that they were moving up the release date for Season 6, Part 2. Here's what to know about the new schedule.
data.text:
Surprise! Fans won’t have to wait as long to get the second batch of episodes for Cobra Kai Season 6. When will Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 come out on Netflix? Find out the new release date, which is two weeks earlier than originally planned, below.

Cobra Kai is Netflix’s beloved martial arts series and the sequel to the original The Karate Kid films. The streaming giant acquired the series for its third season in June 2020 after it initially aired on YouTube Red/Premium. The series returned for its sixth and final season on July 18, 2024.

“Our senseis and students must decide if and how they will compete in the Sekai Taikai — the world championships of karate,” Netflix’s synopsis for Season 6 reads.

ForbesWhat Time Does 'Cobra Kai' Season 6, Part 1 Come Out On Netflix?

At the star-studded premiere for Season 6, Part 1, on July 17, the cast in attendance included Ralph Macchio, William Zabka, Martin Kove, Xolo Maridueña, Jacob Bertrand, Mary Mouser, Tanner Buchanan, Peyton List, Gianni Decenzo, Courtney Henggeler, Vanessa Rubio, Dallas Dupree Young, Yuji Okumoto, Griffin Santopietro, Oona O’Brien, and more.

Creators Jon Hurwitz, Hayden Schlossberg, and Josh Heald took the stage to announce that Season 6, Part 2 will be released two weeks early. Discover the latest details below.

When Does Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 Come Out On Netflix?

Cobra Kai Season 6, part two, will now be released on November 15 at 3 a.m. ET / 12 a.m. PT on Netflix — about four months after part one. The second batch of five episodes were originally slated to drop on November 25.

“You heard it here first. Send it to the internet. November 15. Same day as Jake Paul vs Mike Tyson. Netflix Fight Night. No undercard. Two main events. Let’s do it,” the creators shared at the July 17 premiere in Los Angeles, according to Deadline.

How Many Episodes Will Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 Have?

Like parts one and three, the second part of Cobra Kai Season 6 will also have five episodes. There will be 15 episodes in total in the show’s supersized final season.

When Will Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 3 Come Out?

Netflix has not announced the release date for the third part of the sixth season of Cobra Kai. The streamer has shared that the final five episodes will be available sometime in 2025.

Check out the Season 6 release schedule below.

Part 1 - July 18, 2024 at 3:00 a.m. ET / 12 a.m. PT

Episode 1: "Peacetime in the Valley"

Episode 2: “The Prize”

Episode 3: “Sleeper”

Episode 4: “Underdogs”

Episode 5: “Best of the Best”

Part 2 - November 15, 2024 at 3:00 a.m. ET / 12 a.m. PT

Episode 6

Episode 7

Episode 8

Episode 9

Episode 10

Part 3 - TBA in 2025

Episode 11

Episode 12

Episode 13

Episode 14

Episode 15

Stay tuned to learn more about Cobra Kai parts two and three. Watch the official trailer for Cobra Kai Season 6 below.
